result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to defendant re: payment of atty fees (full $ amount assessed in 13CT301)
Petition and Order for Payment of Fee per statement submitted by Atty Sarbacker in case nos:  13 CT 301, 14 CF 1, 14 CF 9, 14 CF 33, and 14 CF 565

ADDRESS INFO for Robert G. Marks
Current: N3139 Co Rd V #6, Poynette, WI 53955 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2015)
Prior: N1650 Cty. Road GG, Coloma, WI 54930 United States

Cases called: 14CF1, 14CF33 & 14CF565, 15CF341, Defendant Robert G. Marks in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 7 in 14CF1, Ct. 3 in 14CF33, ct, 1 in 15CF341. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence in 14CF1 - 50 days jail commence forth with at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $1,888 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 36 mo. revocation, 36 mo. IID.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. (4 days jail credit) In 14CF33, $1,158 fine, submit DNA sample. (5 days jail credit) All other counts and 14CF565 read in and dismissed. In 15CF341, on ct. 1, 5 days jail, consecutive to 14CF1, $443 costs (3 days jail credit) All other counts in cases, if not addressed, are read in and dismissed. All posted cash bonds to be applied to the fines.
plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2015 at 2:45 p.m.
